citation.article-title: Transfer of Defluvibacter lusatiensis to the genus Aquamicrobium as Aquamicrobium lusatiense comb. nov. and description of Aquamicrobium aerolatum sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aquamicrobium lusatiense comb. nov.
Basonym: Defluvibacter lusatiensis Fritsche et al. 1999.
The description is as given by Fritsche et al. (1999a) with the following amendments.
Ubiquinone 10 is the major quinone type.
Predominant fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c and 19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
The type strain is strain S1T (=CIP 106844T =DSM 11099T).
